message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is about improving neural machine translation (NMT) models using multi-task learning (MTL) and learning the training schedule for MTL. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers topics related to natural language processing and computational linguistics. The paper also proposes a framework for learning the training schedule using policy learning methods, which falls under the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper uses auxiliary syntactic and semantic tasks to improve generalization, which is related to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also mentions the use of an oracle policy algorithm, which is a reinforcement learning method, falling under the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper mentions experiments on low-resource NMT settings, which could be related to cs.CV (Computer Vision) as low-resource scenarios are also common in computer vision tasks.
